PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : Compazine 10 mg PO q4-6h p.r.n. nausea Ativan 1 mg sublingually q4h nausea , anxiety . Nursing services with evaluation and treatment . Physical therapy services , evaluation and treatment . Pro-time with INR on 02/03/2000 with the report faxed to 008-653-3263 , and VNA administration of Fragmin subcutaneously b.i.d. HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : Ms. Counts has known metastatic breast cancer and has been on treatment with Fareston and Aredia . On the day she was seen for her regular office evaluation and treatment , she was noted to be very slightly confused , nauseated , vomiting , and dehydrated . Laboratory studies were obtained which showed that she was hypercalcemic and mildly azotemic . Her calcium was 16.6 with an albumin of 2.5 and her creatinine was 2.6 . She was admitted to the hospital and given intravenous Saline and then Lasix . She was also treated with Calcitonin . During this hospitalization with hydration and diuresis , her calcium fell to normal levels and her renal function corrected to normal . It was felt that the cause of her hypercalcemia is related to progression of metastatic breast cancer and possibly as a flare to Fareston . The Fareston was discontinued , Lupron 7.5 mg monthly was initiated and Arimidex 1 mg PO q.d. was initiated . She was able to tolerate these medicines quite well . In addition , we started her on Taxol 80 mg per meter square with the first dose administered on 01/30/2000 and to be continued as an outpatient . She complained of some pain in her left lower extremity . Deep venous thrombosis was shown by color flow Doppler and she was started on Fragmin and Coumadin during this hospitalization . Fragmin will be continued as an outpatient until the Coumadin dose is established and then this can be discontinued . The patient was discharged home with nursing care and will be followed by Dr. Fyfesaul with her first appointment on 02/06/2000 . We will continue her on treatment with Taxol .
